author: S P
text:
Officials are in the process of revising the Master Plan for the Salem Local Planning Authority (SLPA) that would focus on developing the infrastructure including ring road and bridges in the Corporation limits and on the city outskirts.The existing master plan was approved in March 2005 and covers the entire Corporation area and 154 villages in the district, spread over 650 sq. km. The land use zone for residential areas, commercial and industrial purpose was clearly listed in the plan and permission was given for construction activities accordingly.

However, with the expansion of the city and its outskirts, there is much need for infrastructural development. As many as 128 villages were added to the proposed new plan. A Bengaluru-based consultant appointed by Tamil Nadu Urban Infrastructure Financial Services Limited is in the process of preparing a master plan and consultative meeting with stakeholders was conducted in the past two years. But residents said that the proposal for infrastructure development in the existing master plan was not implemented. They said that event the portalwww. salem.tn.nic.in/slpawas not updated and it carried few details.
title: Salem: focus on improving roads
